creator: sai101
title: How to Make a Spongebob Pineapple House
materials_required: Circular roll of cardboard (to use as core)
description: This project outlines the construction of a scaled prototype of Spongebob's pineapple house to be used as a prop. It involves building the house from cardboard using pyramid tessellation shapes and installing a circuit with LEDs that can be turned on with a switch.
steps: Construct the base by cutting a circle from a wooden plank to fit snugly inside the cardboard core.
Cut out 120 isosceles triangles from cardboard and glue the lateral edges of three triangles together to create 40 pyramids. This will be used to cover the cardboard core.
Glue the pyramid shapes onto the core, leaving spaces for the door, window, and switch.
Build a parallel circuit with 5 LEDs, a switch, and a 100 OHM resistor to prevent the LEDs from deteriorating. Build this on a bread board first.
Solder the circuit together, connecting the resistor to the switch and the anode side of an LED. Connect all LED cathodes together, and then connect the switch to the anode side of the battery.
Cut out the door, window, and exhaust from foam using a foam cutter, ensuring the window and door are the same width.
Paint the accessories black and the pineapple orange, then let them dry overnight.
Glue the door, window, and exhaust to the pineapple.
Drill holes for the LEDs and insert them. Place the battery at the bottom and position the switch for easy access.
Add fake leaves at the top of the pineapple, then touch up with any additional details to finish the model.
